headline: VIDEO: Coalition of US lawmakers traveling to front lines of war with direct message
sentences:
As the most reliable and balanced news aggregation service on the internet, DML News App offers the following information published by Fox News:
A bipartisan congressional delegation is heading to Poland Friday to get as close to the Russia-Ukraine war as safely possible and to see firsthand what is needed to help the Ukrainian people.

Those planning to go with Fitzpatrick are Republican Reps. Michael McCaul of Texas and Ann Wagner of Missouri and Democratic Reps. Gregory Meeks of New York, David Cicilline of Rhode Island and Gerry Connolly of Virginia.

The delegation is made up of Democrats and Republicans on the House Foreign Affairs Committee in a united front to condemn the brutal war launched by Russia and to stand in support of the Ukrainian people.
They are planning to stay in the region through Monday and Fitzpatrick is hoping to be able to cross into Ukraine, if the military escorts coordinating the trip will allow it.
“The Ukrainians are showing the world why they should have been in the EU (European Union) a long time ago (and) why they should have been in NATO a long time ago,” he added.

The article goes on to state the following:
The trip is especially meaningful for Rep. Brian Fitzpatrick, R-Pa., who lived in Ukraine when he was an FBI agent.
He worked with Ukrainian law enforcement and government on anti-corruption, cyber security and counterintelligence efforts to counter Russia.
And if you have the DML NEWS APP, please tell people to download it today and help conservatives have a real voice.

WATCH BELOW:
To get more information about this article, please visit Fox News.
These are my friends over there,” Fitzpatrick said in a Fox News interview.
“I will go as far into that territory as they will allow me to go.
Listen to the latest daily DML podcasts below!
I’d go to Kyiv if they let me,” he said.
